u.a: We are sitting in the room. Wawrzon does not want to say anything. Hanna asks him [this] question.
which carol do you like the best ?
Wawrzon says a line from the carol but it is not very clear .
Wawrzon mutters the words of the carol .
Wawrzon distorts the words and they do not make much sense .
but we wońt play it loudly .
tell auntie what carols are these and who sings them .
Wawrzon is listening to the record and repeating some words .
żylis Gara is a famous Polish opera singer .

do you also have an Ochman ?
show us . fetch this record and show it to us .
Wawrzon is looking for the record .
do not look for the Ochman .
Wawrzon should use the imperfective aspect with the negative request .
you dońt want me to look for it ?
no, dońt look for the Ochman .
so should I look for it or not ?
dońt look (for it) . the record will jump .
Wawrzon could not decide whether to use the infinitive or past participle when forming the future of the word "wyskakiwać; it is hard to determine what he means by it .
yes . here it will jump out .
Katarzyna understood that Wawrzon had talked about the gramophone needle .
I dońt have to look for it if you dońt want me to .
so should I look for it or not ?
look for it . is it anywhere here ?
this record . and this record and this record .

tą = tę , it is a very common error .
what about this record and this record ?
one like this and the other like that .
one like this and the other like that ?
they are looking for the Ochman record . Wawrzon is listening to the carols and looking at the records .

but I dońt know how . you must ask your daddy .
I dońt know how to play records .
so should I play that Armstrong ?
what for, if we are listening to the carols ?
good . and we wońt listen to the carols any more today all right ?
Father is talking about Warzon and his constant listening to the carols . he calls Wawrzon a genius .
this is how he recognizes it .
did you see how dirty these records are ?
someone was touching them didńt he ?
the record is playing . Wawrzon is listening .

Wawrzon is listening to the record . then he runs into the hall .
N|father-DIM:MASC:NOM:S PRO|I & NOM:S V|have & IMPF:PRES:1S N|bottle-FEM:ACC:S .
but you cańt when we are listening to the records .
Father makes food for Wawrzon . Wawrzon hears something break in the kitchen .
Wawrzon runs to the kitchen . they both return after a while .
did you tell them what you did yesterday ?
Bartek . and what did Bartek do to you ?
did you tell them what Bartek did to you ?
you didńt show your finger, did you ?
what did he do to you ?
Wawrzon is showing his finger . Katarzyna is looking at it .
Father gives Wawrzon a bottle . Wawrzon is drinking tea from the bottle .
Wawrzon is not interested in what is being said . he is listening to the records and drinking his tea from the bottle .
Bartek wasńt here yesterday, that's a lie .
and who are these two girls who just went to the store ?
what city do they live in ?
how do you get around in Gdynia ?
Wawrzon got a new excavator truck . he wants to talk about it .
did you show the excavator truck that you got ?
Wawrzon is running to get the excavator .
what does the excavator do, Wawrzon ?
probably some removable parts of the excavator have fallen out . the verb "składa" should be reflexivized .
Wawrzon is playing with the toy .
Wawrzon is pretending that the excavator is a bulldozer .
now it is going to be a bulldozer .
what is it going to be ?
Wawrzon is playing with the excavator .
what are you going to do ?
the record is over . Father comes up to the record player .
well, the record is over . so what should I do now ?
dońt play (it) . I dońt like Arms ...
well, I dońt know . Eddie took it .
oh, here it is, here it is .
Father and Wawrzon are standing by the record player .
Father is playing the carols and talking to Katarzyna and Hanna .
uncle Rysio is like that, isńt he ?
you haveńt told us who was here yesterday . that Michał and grandma were here .
tell auntie who Michał is . who is he from ?
and who else lives there with Janusz and Baśka ?
there is Ania . is there anyone else ?
I think you'll be going to bed today, uncle .
and then we'll go to the institute .
Wawrzon puts building blocks in his mouth .
dońt put that block in your mouth or I'll be angry .
what is it outside the window ?
do you know what it is ?
can you see how it's spinning ?
it's probably a pinwheel . on the balcony .
Father reminds Wawrzon about a story they read a while ago .
and what was the story called ?
what were the names of these men ?
one was doing flips and yelling until he'd drop dead .
Wawrzon is listening to the carol .

Father is holding the book with stories .
so what does it say here ?
then dońt . and what is this story called ?
and will you read this one ?
Father is trying to interest Wawrzon in the book, but Wawrzon does not respond . the carol is over .
there'll be glory on high again .
now you will go to a monastery . with a monastery school .
I wońt go . glory on high .
what should I play for you ?
but for the last time, all right ?
Father is playing the record . Wawrzon is lying on the floor and listening to it .
Father is talking to Katarzyna and Hanna .
we have to take apart the records, the record player and the radio .

it is already fixed . so we dońt have to .
Wawrzon comes up to his father .
read to auntie . but read from the beginning .
Wawrzon wants to play the carols .
but you already said that was the last time and that's it . how many times do I have to play it ?
this one now . this one is also a nice carol .
a very nice carol . there are little bells in it .
so should I play it from the beginning ?

Wawrzon throws the book on the floor . Father wants to interest Wawrzon in the story . Wawrzon runs away and lies down on the floor .
Father talks to Hanna and Katarzyna .
all right, we'll go to bed .
Wawrzon is playing with building blocks .
you'll be putting a tree together, wońt you ?
trees grow in an orchard, dońt they ?
Father changes him into his pajamas .
we'll do pee pee, all right ?
Wawrzon urinates . then they go to the bedroom . Father undresses Wawrzon .
yes, the bed is covered . you'll lay down nicely .
would you like me to bring you your bottle ?
